gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: GT10 - delta-O18 and Deuterium from the U.S. GEOTRACES NAT,GEOTRACES: Intercal Phosphate Oxygen projects of the U.S. GEOTRACES,U.S. GEOTRACES programs

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Instituto Portugues do Mar e da Atmosfera

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Depth profiles of seawater d18O and dD from 8 stations of the KN199-04 cruise. Dataset Description: <p>This data are published in: Voelker, A.H.L., Colman, A., Olack, G., Waniek, J.J. and Hodell, D., 2015. Oxygen and hydrogen isotope signatures of Northeast Atlantic water masses. Deep Sea Research Part II: Topical Studies in Oceanography, doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.dsr2.2014.11.006">http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.dsr2.2014.11.006</a>.</p><p>Data for KN204-01 (GT11) not yet submitted. (9 June 2014)</p> Acquisition Description: <p><strong>Methods for Godwin Lab/ A. Voelker data:</strong><br />Water oxygen and hydrogen isotopes were measured simultaneously by cavity ringdown laser spectroscopy (CRDS) using a L1102-i Picarro water isotope analyzer and A0211 high-precision vaporizer. Each sample was injected nine times into the vaporizer. Memory effects from previous samples were avoided by rejecting the first three analyses. Values for the final six injections were averaged with in-run precision of less than ±0.1 for d18O and ±1 for dD (1-standard deviation). Calibration of results to V-SMOW was achieved by analyzing internal standards before and after each set of 7 or 8 samples. Internal standards were calibrated against V-SMOW, GISP, and SLAP. All results are reported in parts per thousand (o/oo) relative to V-SMOW.&nbsp;<br />The instrument was calibrated at the start of each run using three working standards from the University of Cambridge (Delta, Botty, Spit) with known values calibrated against V-SMOW, GISP, and SLAP. An internal seawater standard (SPIT) was analysed after every three samples to correct for instrument drift.&nbsp;</p><p><br /><strong>Methods for &nbsp;d18O and dD analysis at the University of Chicago</strong><br />All seawater samples were processed on a GasBench II (Thermo, Bremen, Germany) with a CTC GC Pal (CTC analytics) and interfaced to a Delta V Plus isotope ratio mass spectrometer (Thermo). &nbsp;A hydrogen equilibration method using Pt catalyst was used for dD analysis; a classical CO2-H2O equilibration was used for d18O analysis. &nbsp;In both cases, samples were entrained in a helium carrier gas with gas sample cleanup and removal of water vapor achieved on the GasBench II peripheral prior to isotopic analysis in continuous flow mode on the mass spectrometer.</p><p>For D/H analyses, Pt catalyst sticks (Thermo P/N 1091831) were loaded into Exetainer tubes (Labco, 12 mL, screw cap with butyl rubber septa inserts). &nbsp;Water (samples and standards) were added to each tube using fresh 1 mL syringes (BD syringe) and needles (20 or 22 Ga, 1 or 1.5 inch lengths, BD precision Glide), with 300 µL of seawater sample used for all D/H runs. &nbsp;Standards were either primary (VSMOW2, SLAP2, and/or GISP from the IAEA) or house standards calibrated to the primary standards. &nbsp;The exetainers with Pt catalyst and water were loaded into the GasBench II heater block at 26°C in a group of 5 rows of 10 tubes. &nbsp;The CTC GC PAL sampling and flushing needles were side by side and spaced by 5 positions in the heater block. &nbsp;The first set of 5 tubes were flushed (2% H2 in He (Airgas), 20 mL/min), then following a pause, sampling of the first set of tubes was completed coincident with flushing of the adjacent set of tubes. Total incubation time of H2 gas mix with water and Pt catalyst was 68 minutes for each tube (end of flushing to start of analysis). &nbsp;The dD analysis on headspace H2 takes 15 min: 60 sec transfer time, 3 reference gas pulses (20 sec each, 30 and 80 sec spacing, last used as the reference peak) and 8 sample pulses (100 µL sampling loop, 45 sec load time at 0.5 mL/min, 35 second injection time at 1 mL/min, through PoraPlot Q GC column, 25m x 0.32mm, Varian, at 50°C). &nbsp;Typically the middle six sample peaks are used for isotopic composition determination, and linear plot of the peak’s result vs. peak number determined and the value for the first peak in the series is calculated from the slope and intercept.<br />For d18O runs, capped Exetainer tubes were flushed with 0.3% CO2 in He (Airgas, ca. 20 mL/min) using the PAL autosampler. &nbsp; Then 200 to 300 microliters of seawater or standard was injected into the Exetainer tube as described for the D/H sample injection. &nbsp;The tubes were incubated in the Gasbench II heater block at &nbsp;26°C for 24 hrs before the analysis was initiated. &nbsp;The CTC GC PAL sampling parameters, GasBench II injection loop program and pattern of reference and sample peaks, and peak processing was similar to that described for dD measurements.</p><p>Raw d18O analyses are corrected for the fractionation factor between water and CO2 as a function of temperature of equilibration, mass balance between water oxygen and CO2 oxygen present in the tube, and to the isotopic reference materials using standard practices (Friedman and O’Neil). &nbsp; The D/H analyses are corrected to the standards (Nelson, 2000), and then a uniform -2.0 o/oo salt correction (Martineau et al., 2012) is applied to compensate for isotopic enrichment of the headspace H2 for the seawater samples. &nbsp;Both oxygen and hydrogen isotope compositions are reported on the VSMOW scale</p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-0827122 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward.do?AwardNumber=0827122
Funding provided by Centro de Investigacao Marinha e Ambiental (CIMAR) Award Number: PesT-C/MAR/LA0015/2009

Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: GEOTRACES: Intercalibration of Phosphate Oxygen Isotope Analyses and Sample Processing Techniques

gmd:name.gmx:Anchor: GEOTRACES: Intercalibration of Phosphate Oxygen Isotope Analyses and Sample Processing Techniques

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Abstract:The oxygen isotope composition of dissolved phosphate has the utility of tracing sources of this nutrient in continental shelf and upper slope environments, yield insights into remineralization mechanisms in the open ocean, and reveal biological turnover rates of phosphate. However, currently only a few published measurements are available. Inclusion of this parameter into the GEOTRACES Program would significantly enhance the data set but requires that his component be intercalibrated. For this reason, a scientist from the University of Chicago plans to collect and analyze water samples for the oxygen isotope composition of dissolved phosphate during the GEOTRACES intercalibration cruises to the Atlantic and Pacific Ocean. Once the analyses are completed, a set of recommendations on the best practices to obtain reliable measurements would be made accessible to the ocean sciences community. In addition, the researcher proposes to distribute samples and standards for the analysis of oxygen isotope composition of dissolved phosphate.As regards broader impacts, this intercalibration effort could represent a first step towards the development of a new tracer for the ocean sciences community aimed at furthering our understanding of the phosphorus cycle.

2 = unusual but accepted; 9 = rejected http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/472880.rdf Name: dD_2 Units: permil V-SMOW Description: Isotope ratio of 2H:1H; 2nd analysis http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/472881.rdf Name: dD_QF_2 Units: dimensionless Description: Quality flag of results from 2nd analysis: 1= ok; gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/DEPH/ Name: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/ADATAA01/ Name: Date (UT as yyyymmdd) Description: Unavailable http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/AHMSAA01/ Name: Time (UT as hh24miss) Description: Time elapsed between 00:00 UT on the date of the event of interest and that event. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/ACYC/ Name: Reference numbers Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/ACYC/ Name: Reference numbers Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/ACYC/ Name: Reference numbers Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Cruise ID number; General Description: cruise designation; name
PI-supplied Description: Station number within cruise; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: Nominal latitude of station. Obtained from KN199-04 station waypoints provided by Chief Sci.; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Nominal longitude of station. Obtained from KN199-04 station waypoints provided by Chief Sci.; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Observation/sample depth in meters. Calculated from CTD pressure.; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.
PI-supplied Description: Cast identifier; numbered consecutively within a station.; General Description: cast or profile number

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events.; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.

PI-supplied Description: Date sample collected; UTC; General Description: date; generally reported in GMT as YYYYMMDD (year; month; day); also as MMDD (month; day); EqPac dates are local Hawaii time NERC Description: Unavailable

PI-supplied Description: Time sample collected; UTC; General Description: Time GMT defined as HHMM; time of day; generally reported in GMT as HHMM (hours and minutes) but may also be HH.H (decimal hours) or HHMMSS (hours; minutes and seconds); in EqPac time is reported as Hawaii local time NERC Description: Time elapsed between 00:00 UT on the date of the event of interest and that event.

PI-supplied Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g. NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette.; General Description: water bottle number, generally assigned to a position on a CTD rosette, identifies all samples drawn from a given bottle

PI-supplied Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; rangies from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number.; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples; ranges from 5033 to 6078 for KN199-04 and from 6112 to 8148 for KN204-01.; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

PI-supplied Description: Internal Lab sample ID given by A. Colman; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers
PI-supplied Description: Laboratory responsible for analysis: 1 = Godwin; 2 = Chicago; General Description: Laboratory Id – Lab identifier where experiments were conducted
PI-supplied Description: Isotope ratio 18O/16O; 1st analysis; General Description: isotope ratio H218O/H216O, reported in delta18O notation

PI-supplied Description: 1 sigma standard deviation for the samples analysed by the Chicago lab (Colman): 1st analysis.; General Description: Generic standard deviation value, taking on the units of the parameter that it is tied to.

PI-supplied Description: Quality flag of results from 1st analysis: 1= ok; 2 = unusual but accepted; 9 = rejected; General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details
PI-supplied Description: Isotope ratio 18O/16O; 2nd analysis; General Description: isotope ratio H218O/H216O, reported in delta18O notation

PI-supplied Description: 1 sigma standard deviation for the samples analysed by the Chicago lab (Colman): 2nd analysis.; General Description: Generic standard deviation value, taking on the units of the parameter that it is tied to.

PI-supplied Description: Quality flag of results from 2nd analysis: 1= ok; 2 = unusual but accepted; 9 = rejected; General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details
PI-supplied Description: Average of d18O analyses; General Description: isotope ratio H218O/H216O, reported in delta18O notation
PI-supplied Description: 1 sigma standard deviation; General Description: Generic standard deviation value, taking on the units of the parameter that it is tied to.
PI-supplied Description: Isotope ratio of 2H:1H; 1st analysis; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined
PI-supplied Description: Chicago value corrected by -2 o/oo; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined
PI-supplied Description: 1 sigma standard deviation Chicago; General Description: Generic standard deviation value, taking on the units of the parameter that it is tied to.

PI-supplied Description: Quality flag of results from 1st analysis: 1= ok; 2 = unusual but accepted; 9 = rejected; General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details
PI-supplied Description: Isotope ratio of 2H:1H; 2nd analysis; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

PI-supplied Description: Quality flag of results from 2nd analysis: 1= ok; 2 = unusual but accepted; 9 = rejected; General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details
PI-supplied Description: Average of dD analyses; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined
PI-supplied Description: dD; 1 sigma standard deviation; General Description: Generic standard deviation value, taking on the units of the parameter that it is tied to.
PI-supplied Description: name given to a leg of the cruise; General Description: Identifier for a segment of a leg of a cruise, where a leg may have been broken into parts.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p><strong>Methods for Godwin Lab/ A. Voelker data:</strong><br />Water oxygen and hydrogen isotopes were measured simultaneously by cavity ringdown laser spectroscopy (CRDS) using a L1102-i Picarro water isotope analyzer and A0211 high-precision vaporizer. Each sample was injected nine times into the vaporizer. Memory effects from previous samples were avoided by rejecting the first three analyses. Values for the final six injections were averaged with in-run precision of less than ±0.1 for d18O and ±1 for dD (1-standard deviation). Calibration of results to V-SMOW was achieved by analyzing internal standards before and after each set of 7 or 8 samples. Internal standards were calibrated against V-SMOW, GISP, and SLAP. All results are reported in parts per thousand (o/oo) relative to V-SMOW.&nbsp;<br />The instrument was calibrated at the start of each run using three working standards from the University of Cambridge (Delta, Botty, Spit) with known values calibrated against V-SMOW, GISP, and SLAP. An internal seawater standard (SPIT) was analysed after every three samples to correct for instrument drift.&nbsp;</p><p><br /><strong>Methods for &nbsp;d18O and dD analysis at the University of Chicago</strong><br />All seawater samples were processed on a GasBench II (Thermo, Bremen, Germany) with a CTC GC Pal (CTC analytics) and interfaced to a Delta V Plus isotope ratio mass spectrometer (Thermo). &nbsp;A hydrogen equilibration method using Pt catalyst was used for dD analysis; a classical CO2-H2O equilibration was used for d18O analysis. &nbsp;In both cases, samples were entrained in a helium carrier gas with gas sample cleanup and removal of water vapor achieved on the GasBench II peripheral prior to isotopic analysis in continuous flow mode on the mass spectrometer.</p><p>For D/H analyses, Pt catalyst sticks (Thermo P/N 1091831) were loaded into Exetainer tubes (Labco, 12 mL, screw cap with butyl rubber septa inserts). &nbsp;Water (samples and standards) were added to each tube using fresh 1 mL syringes (BD syringe) and needles (20 or 22 Ga, 1 or 1.5 inch lengths, BD precision Glide), with 300 µL of seawater sample used for all D/H runs. &nbsp;Standards were either primary (VSMOW2, SLAP2, and/or GISP from the IAEA) or house standards calibrated to the primary standards. &nbsp;The exetainers with Pt catalyst and water were loaded into the GasBench II heater block at 26°C in a group of 5 rows of 10 tubes. &nbsp;The CTC GC PAL sampling and flushing needles were side by side and spaced by 5 positions in the heater block. &nbsp;The first set of 5 tubes were flushed (2% H2 in He (Airgas), 20 mL/min), then following a pause, sampling of the first set of tubes was completed coincident with flushing of the adjacent set of tubes. Total incubation time of H2 gas mix with water and Pt catalyst was 68 minutes for each tube (end of flushing to start of analysis). &nbsp;The dD analysis on headspace H2 takes 15 min: 60 sec transfer time, 3 reference gas pulses (20 sec each, 30 and 80 sec spacing, last used as the reference peak) and 8 sample pulses (100 µL sampling loop, 45 sec load time at 0.5 mL/min, 35 second injection time at 1 mL/min, through PoraPlot Q GC column, 25m x 0.32mm, Varian, at 50°C). &nbsp;Typically the middle six sample peaks are used for isotopic composition determination, and linear plot of the peak’s result vs. peak number determined and the value for the first peak in the series is calculated from the slope and intercept.<br />For d18O runs, capped Exetainer tubes were flushed with 0.3% CO2 in He (Airgas, ca. 20 mL/min) using the PAL autosampler. &nbsp; Then 200 to 300 microliters of seawater or standard was injected into the Exetainer tube as described for the D/H sample injection. &nbsp;The tubes were incubated in the Gasbench II heater block at &nbsp;26°C for 24 hrs before the analysis was initiated. &nbsp;The CTC GC PAL sampling parameters, GasBench II injection loop program and pattern of reference and sample peaks, and peak processing was similar to that described for dD measurements.</p><p>Raw d18O analyses are corrected for the fractionation factor between water and CO2 as a function of temperature of equilibration, mass balance between water oxygen and CO2 oxygen present in the tube, and to the isotopic reference materials using standard practices (Friedman and O’Neil). &nbsp; The D/H analyses are corrected to the standards (Nelson, 2000), and then a uniform -2.0 o/oo salt correction (Martineau et al., 2012) is applied to compensate for isotopic enrichment of the headspace H2 for the seawater samples. &nbsp;Both oxygen and hydrogen isotope compositions are reported on the VSMOW scale</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: GO-FLO PI Supplied Instrument Description:Demi station samples were collected from the GEOTRACES GO-FLO rosette. The U.S. GEOTRACES sampling system consisted of 24 Teflon-coated GO-FLO bottles. Instrument Name: GO-FLO Bottle Instrument Short Name:GO-FLO Instrument Description: GO-FLO bottle cast used to collect water samples for pigment, nutrient, plankton, etc. The GO-FLO sampling bottle is specially designed to avoid sample contamination at the surface, internal spring contamination, loss of sample on deck (internal seals), and exchange of water from different depths. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/30/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Niskin bottle Instrument Name: Niskin bottle Instrument Short Name:Niskin bottle Instrument Description: A Niskin bottle (a next generation water sampler based on the Nansen bottle) is a cylindrical, non-metallic water collection device with stoppers at both ends. The bottles can be attached individually on a hydrowire or deployed in 12, 24 or 36 bottle Rosette systems mounted on a frame and combined with a CTD. Niskin bottles are used to collect discrete water samples for a range of measurements including pigments, nutrients, plankton, etc. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL0412/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: IR Mass Spec PI Supplied Instrument Description:Colman Lab: All seawater samples were processed on a GasBench II (Thermo, Bremen, Germany) with a CTC GC Pal (CTC analytics) and interfaced to a Delta V Plus isotope ratio mass spectrometer (Thermo) Instrument Name: Isotope-ratio Mass Spectrometer Instrument Short Name:IR Mass Spec Instrument Description: The Isotope-ratio Mass Spectrometer is a particular type of mass spectrometer used to measure the relative abundance of isotopes in a given sample (e.g. VG Prism II Isotope Ratio Mass-Spectrometer). Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/LAB16/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Gas Chromatograph PI Supplied Instrument Description:PoraPlot Q GC column, 25m x 0.32mm, Varian, at 50C). Instrument Name: Gas Chromatograph Instrument Short Name:Gas Chromatograph Instrument Description: Instrument separating gases, volatile substances, or substances dissolved in a volatile solvent by transporting an inert gas through a column packed with a sorbent to a detector for assay. (from SeaDataNet, BODC) Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/LAB02/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Spectrometer PI Supplied Instrument Description:Godwin/Voelker Lab: Water oxygen and hydrogen isotopes were measured simultaneously by cavity ringdown laser spectroscopy (CRDS) using a L1102-i Picarro water isotope analyzer and A0211 high-precision vaporizer. Instrument Name: Spectrometer Instrument Short Name:Spectrometer Instrument Description: A spectrometer is an optical instrument used to measure properties of light over a specific portion of the electromagnetic spectrum. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL0460/

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
